newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for December 9.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for December 9.

text.p: Gulf of Mexico crude port Dos Bocas remained closed Monday along with two other major ports as of 1000 local/1600 GMT, the Communications and Transport Ministry said in a daily update.

Dos Bocas was shut on Sunday 1730/2330 because of wind speeds between 25 to 35 kilometers per hour. Port captain Jorge Rojano Rodriguez said winds speeds appeared to be slowing and the port should reopen later in the day.
Crude port Pajaritos in Veracruz reopened Monday 0800/1400 after being closed most of the weekend.
The ministry also reported Frontera port closed amid wind speeds southeast of 15 to 20 kilometers per hour and Campeche port shut with wind speeds between 20 to 30 kilometers per hour
Smaller boats were restricted from sailing at the following ports because of wind speeds: Veracruz, Tuxpan, Nautla, Alvarado, Coatzacoalcos and Salina Cruz.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Gulf of Mexico, Caribbean and Pacific Coast.

Light rains along the coast of Baja California, Sonora, Sinaloa and Nayarit states. Winds from the east and northeast of 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 kilometers/11 to 17 miles per hour) and waves as high as three to five feet.
Winds in the Gulf of Tehuantepec heading north and northeast reached 20 to 25 knots (38 to 47 kilometers/22 to 28 miles per hour) and waves eight to 10 feet.

A cold front in the north of the gulf sending rains and northeast winds of 15 to 20 knots (19 to 37 kilometers/11 to 22 miles per hour) and wave heights of between five and eight feet in the states of Veracruz, Tabasco and the Yucatan peninsula.
A cold front in the area subsiding, sending light rains along coast of Quintana Roo with northeast winds of 15 to 20 knots and waves five to eight feet high.
